title: R for Data Science Workshop: Programming -- Functions, Vectors, and Iteration
description:
This is the fourth meetup in a series of six workshops to work through the book R for Data Science by Hadley Wickham and Garrett Grolemund. Please bring a laptop with R Studio and R loaded up. (Let us know if you have questions or need help getting that set up.)

We'll be covering these chapters:
+ Pipes with magrittr
+ Functions
+ Vectors
+ Iteration with purrr

Agenda
+ 6:30 - 7pm : Dinner and Networking
+ 7 - 8:30pm : Workshop

title: ALL the Ladies in Tech Happy Hour: Winter Edition
description:
***NOTE: RSVP is on Eventbrite for this event! Here's the link: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/all-the-ladies-in-tech-happy-hour-winter-edition-tickets-39194718458 ***

This is a quarterly mega happy hour / networking mixer with the goal of connecting women in tech, data, and code in ATX.
Apana's is offering a Happy Hour special of $1 off beer or wine. We've reserved their back room and around 7pm, we'll do some quick introductions for all of the groups present and a preview of the events they have planned for the winter.
We're also partnering with Dress for Success Austin to do a drive for shoes and purses at this event -- if you have any extra shoes or purses, please consider bringing them to help women who are in need!
This event is cohosted by these groups (please reach out if you know of a group that would like to co-host with us!):
+ R-Ladies Austin
+ Women in Data Science
+ PyLadies ATX
+ Women Who Code
+ ChickTech Austin
+ Austin Women in Technology
+ Girl Develop It Austin
Feel free to bring guests, but please note that we are limiting this event to those who identify as women only.
Can't wait to see you all there!

title: R for Data Science Workshop: Data Wrangling in the Tidyverse
description:
This is the third meetup in a series of six workshops to work through the book R for Data Science by Hadley Wickham and Garrett Grolemund. Please bring a laptop with R Studio and R loaded up. (Let us know if you have questions or need help getting that set up.)

We'll be covering these chapters:
+ Tibbles with tibble
+ Data Import with readr
+ Tidy data with tidyr
+ Relational data with dplyr
+ Strings with stringr
+ Factors with forcats
+ Dates and Times with lubridate

Agenda
+ 6:30 - 7pm : Dinner and Networking
+ 7 - 8:30pm : Workshop

title: Book Club: Dear Data
description:
Hello R-Ladies!

We would like to start a book club series and we are starting with Dear Data (http://www.dear-data.com/theproject), a book about how two women (Giorgia Lupi & Stefanie Posavec) shared data visualization and collection ideas over one year through post cards.The book is largely images of their post cards back and forth with some text interludes.

The book is beautiful and would be a great addition to your library! You can also check it out from the local Austin library or you can view it as an e-book through the library, both free with your library card!

Search for "Dear Data" here on the library website: https://austin.bibliocommons.com/search

Also available at BookPeople : http://www.bookpeople.com/

For the meetup we will:

1) Start with chatting over coffee and/or beer

2) Briefly summarise the book

3) Go through discussion questions

4) Hear your thoughts on the book!

We will follow up as the date approaches with potential discussion questions.

Hope to see you there!

title: R for Data Science Workshop: Exploratory Data Analysis and Workflow
description:
This is the second meetup in a series of six workshops to work through the book R for Data Science by Hadley Wickham and Garrett Grolemund. Please bring a laptop with R Studio and R loaded up. (Let us know if you have questions or need help getting that set up.)

R4DS free online copy: http://r4ds.had.co.nz/

We'll be covering these topics:
+ Exploratory Data Analysis
+ Workflow: Basics, Scripts, and Projects

This includes chapters 4 and 6-8 of R4DS. We expect that you have at least skimmed these chapters before the workshop. We will go over the content of the chapters and then work through some exercises. Hope to see you there!

Agenda
+ 6:30 - 7pm : Dinner and Networking
+ 7 - 8:30pm : Workshop

venues.name: Yodle
venues.address: 12234 N Interstate 35 Frontage Rd #100 Bldg B

title: Boo! Making GitHub Less Scary
description:
R-Ladies Austin is co-hosting this event with Women in Data Science ATX.

GitHub is used by many teams for version control, collaboration on code, documentation, and so much else. But what happens when your files won't merge? How do pull requests work? There's no need to burn it to the ground and start again!

https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/b/8/8/d/600_464867245.jpeg

This workshop with give you a chance to get a little more comfortable with many of the thing Git and GitHub can do and make the whole process less scary.

Agenda

6:30 - 7:15 Dinner/Networking

7:15 - 9:30 Presentations/Work in groups

description:

Schedule

Lightning talks start at 7pm followed by useR video(s)

Lightning talks:

Make Your Data Dance with Plotly - Spring Shi

Tour de Tidyverse -- Caitlin Hudon

Call for Presenters

Would you like to present on a package you find useful? Or on cool, fun ways to learn R? Please email the organizers and we will get you on the schedule!

venues.name: Yodle
venues.address: 12234 N Interstate 35 Frontage Rd #100 Bldg B

title: NASA, R-Ladies, and Austin R User Group!
description:
Presenter: David Meza, Chief Knowledge Architect at NASA (and R-Ladies Supporter)

David has been a great supporter of R-Ladies and reached out to us before we officially launched the group to see how he could help us grow R-Ladies in Texas. We are thrilled that David is going to be making the trip from Houston to speak with us, and have invited the larger Austin R User Group to join as well.

**

Schedule

10:30 - 11am -- coffee and networking

11am - 11:15am -- presentation from R-Ladies

11:15am - 12:45pm -- David Meza on Knowledge Architecture

**

Knowledge Architecture: Framework to extract and share knowledge.

In this presentation, I will introduce a framework for organizations to extract knowledge from their data and effectively present to their end user. Examples, with code, will be demonstrated to the audience.

title: R Studio Conference Recap Movie Night! (R-Ladies Edition)
description:
We will be getting together to eat pizza and watch videos presented by R-Ladies at the recent R Studio 2017 conference. We will have time to watch about 3 videos. Please take this 10 second survey (https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/W9B8BG3) to let us know which videos you would like to watch from the following:

Text Mining the tidy Way – Julia Silge (22 min)

Putting square pegs in round holes: Using list-cols in your dataframe – Jenny Bryan (19 min)

Using Web APIs from R – Amanda Gadrow (23 min)

Opinionated Analysis Development Hilary Parker (25 min)

Dynamic Shiny Interfaces – Bárbara Borges Ribeiro (23 min)

title: Kickoff + Lightning Talks!
description:
Scheduled Lightning Talks:

+ Using R for Healthcare Data
Victoria Valencia, Assistant Director of Healthcare Value at Dell Medical School

+ Project Workflow in R (Using ProjectTemplate)
Caitlin Hudon, Sr. Marketing Data Analyst at web.com

+ Creating an R Package in One Line of Code
Emily Bartha, Data Scientist at HomeAway

+ Intro to ggplot2
Sam Somani, Data Analyst Intern at Integra

+ ReportingTools: Publishing data.frames to HTML

Jessica Larson, Senior Scientist II at Asuragen, Inc.

** We need lightning talk presenters (for this talk and future ones)! Email the organizers if you're interested. **

After the presentations, we'll do a networking happy hour at a nearby bar. More info to come.

title: Women in Data Holiday Party!
description: Come celebrate the holidays with R-Ladies and Women in Data Science at Adelbert's! We've reserved a few tables and plan to serve apps, plus the folks at Anaconda will be covering everyone's first drink! We'd love to see you there.

title: Book Club: Women in Tech-Take Your Career to the Next Level
description:
Our next book in the R-Ladies Austin Book Club is Women in Tech: Take Your Career to the Next Level with Practical Advice and Inspiring Stories by Tarah Wheeler.

Geared toward women who are considering getting into tech, or those already in a tech job who want to take their career to the next level, this book combines practical career advice and inspiring personal stories from successful female tech professionals. A number of successful women in tech also contribute their stories to the book and their is real code and puzzles throughout!

This one should be fun-please join us!

*Note: we've changed the date to accommodate a few extra Meetups this year. Please join us on Wednesday, December 5 to discuss the book!

title: An Evening with Hadley Wickham + R-Ladies Austin
description:
We're very happy to be hosting an evening with Hadley Wickham here in Austin! Hadley literally wrote the book on R for Data Science, is the Chief Scientist at RStudio and Adjunct Professor of Statistics at the University of Auckland, Stanford University, and Rice University.

LOCATION
Dell Medical School
Health Learning Building
Main Auditorium Room 1.111
1501 Red River Street
Austin TX, 78712

PARKING
Parking in the closest parking lot 108 is restricted to those with UT Austin parking permits. Metered parking is available nearby on Red River Street and Trinity Street. Paid parking is also available in the Health Center Garage at the corner of 15th Street and Trinity.

SCHEDULE
6:30 - 7pm -- Food and networking
7 - 8:30pm -- Hadley's talk
8:30 - 9pm -- Questions, wrap-up, and close

title: Modern R for Data Science Workshop w/ Steph Locke
description:
RSVP on Eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/modern-r-for-data-science-workshop-w-steph-locke-tickets-50536282381#tickets. RSVPs are limited to the first 30 sign-ups, so please reserve your spot ASAP!

We are so pleased to welcome Steph Locke, CEO of Locke Data, to present this workshop! Steph generously extended her trip to Texas for the IT/Dev Connections Conference to include a stop in Austin and we're very grateful to have her here with us.

About the Workshop

There have been some changes in R for data science over the past few years. Work hands-on with new packages and ways of doing things to achieve awesome models in many fewer lines of code.

Using packages like dplyr, broom, modelr, recipes, h2o, and furrr we’ll see how we can go from getting data to having an amazing model in no time at all.

This practical day will give people with experience in data science a new set of tools to implement and help them be more productive, whilst for people relatively new to data science it’ll help them get started quickly.

About Steph

Steph is the founder of a consultancy in the UK. Her talks, blog posts, conferences, and business all have one thing in common – they help people get started with data science. Steph holds the Microsoft MVP award for her community contributions. In her spare time, Steph plays board games with her husband and takes copious pictures of her doggos.

title: Book Club: Nice Girls Just Don't Get It
description:
We are excited to announce the next book in our R-Ladies Book Club: Nice Girls Just Don't Get It: 99 Ways to Win the Respect You Deserve, the Success You've Earned, and the Life You Want by Lois P. Frankel & Carol Frohlinger.

This book is not focused on data science and stats as with our previous books, but instead focused on the relationships women have with people in the workforce and at home. The book covers 99 tips on how to get the success you have learned and the life you want.

Please join us for this important discussion over a beer or coffee/tea!

Here is a link to the book on Amazon: https://www.amazon.com/Nice-Girls-Just-Dont-Get/dp/0307590461

title: R-Ladies Book Club: Women in Science!
description:
We'll be discussing the book 'Women in Science: 50 Fearless Pioneers Who Changed the World'. (Past discussions tend to tie what we read about with our experiences in work and life -- thus, it's also a great networking opportunity.)

This is the summer edition of our book club, so we'll also bring art supplies and have some fun making our own illustrated index cards of women in science!

See you there!

title: R Ladies Book Club: Everybody Lies
description:
• What we'll do
We will discuss the book Everybody Lies: Big Data, New Data, and What the Internet Can Tell Us About Who We Really Are by Seth Stephens-Davidowitz. Does what we search for on the web define who we are?

Does Google know our innermost desires?

10 copies available at the Austin Library: https://austin.bibliocommons.com/item/show/1795065067

Amazon link to book: https://www.amazon.com/Everybody-Lies-Internet-About-Really/dp/0062390856 We will discuss questions like these and more! From past book clubs, our discussions tend tie what we read about with out experiences in work and life. Thus, it is a great networking opportunity as well! We hope to see you there!

• What to bring
Copy of book if you want, and your questions and thoughts!

• Important to know

title: Book Club: Weapons of Math Destruction
description:
https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/3/2/6/d/600_466032909.jpeg

For our second book club book, we'll be reading Cathy O'Neil's 'Weapons of Math Destruction'! Here's a quick review:

“O’Neil’s book offers a frightening look at how algorithms are increasingly regulating people… Her knowledge of the power and risks of mathematical models, coupled with a gift for analogy, makes her one of the most valuable observers of the continuing weaponization of big data… [She] does a masterly job explaining the pervasiveness and risks of the algorithms that regulate our lives.”
—New York Times Book Review

This book is available on Amazon (https://www.amazon.com/dp/B019B6VCLO/ref=dp-kindle-redirect?_encoding=UTF8&btkr=1) or from local booksellers like Book People (http://www.bookpeople.com/book/9780553418835).

Agenda: We'll meet at Thunderbird Coffee on Koenig at 6:30, where we'll discuss the book and discussion questions over beverages (they have beer and coffee/tea drinks). Looking forward to seeing you all!

title: Lightning talks with Austin R User Group
description:
Hello R-Ladies!

We are happy to announce this joint meetup with Austin R User Group. The meetup will focus on lightning talks, and we'd love to have volunteers give talks!

Here's the plan for the evening:
6:30-7pm: Snacks, drinks, and mingling
7-8pm: Lightning talks
8-8:30pm: Wrap up and mingling with speakers

Confirmed Speakers:
* Jon Harmon + Jonathan Bratt on RBERT: Cutting-Edge NLP in R

* Meyappan Subbaiah (Zelus Analytics) on the CFB Package

* Alicia Starkey on Workplace gratitude and health in acute-care nurses: An example of analyzing mediation over time

* Brent Schneeman on Who's Tangled Web Is It? Using R and network science, we will find who's at the center of Russia, the Ukraine, the 2016 Election, Wikileaks, and everything else in the news.

* Laura Ellis on Set Analysis: A face off between Venn diagrams and UpSet plots

* Matt Worthington on Working Smarter, Not Harder: Managing Data for the Public Good

Are you interested in presenting your work? Or perhaps sharing a cool package you discovered that others should know about? What about a neat project you want feedback on? Please email us and let us know! rladiesaustin@gmail.com

Hope to see you there!
Victoria + Caitlin

title: Book Club: Invisible Women Data Bias In a World Designed for Men
description:
Hello Ladies!

We are excited to announce our next book club book, Invisible Women: Data Bias in a World Designed for Men. This book was suggested to us by one of our R-Ladies Austin members Sue!

You can find the book here: https://www.amazon.com/Invisible-Women-Data-World-Designed/dp/1419729071

As of today all copies at the Austin Public library are out so must be a good read! Check back later or place a hold on a copy here: https://austin.bibliocommons.com/item/show/2062372067

Should be a great read and engaging discussion over a brew--coffee or beer or tea at Thunderbird! More info on the book below. We hope to see you there!

From Amazon about the book: "Data is fundamental to the modern world. From economic development, to healthcare, to education and public policy, we rely on numbers to allocate resources and make crucial decisions. But because so much data fails to take into account gender, because it treats men as the default and women as atypical, bias and discrimination are baked into our systems. And women pay tremendous costs for this bias, in time, money, and often with their lives.

Celebrated feminist advocate Caroline Criado Perez investigates shocking root cause of gender inequality and research in Invisible Women†‹, diving into women’s lives at home, the workplace, the public square, the doctor’s office, and more. Built on hundreds of studies in the US, the UK, and around the world, and written with energy, wit, and sparkling intelligence, this is a groundbreaking, unforgettable exposé that will change the way you look at the world."

title: Practical ggplot2 with Claus Wilke
description:
We're very happy to be hosting an evening with Claus Wilke, Professor and Department Chair of Integrative Biology at UT Austin, and author of the recently released Fundamentals of Data Visualization book (https://serialmentor.com/dataviz/).

COMPANION MEETUP: BOOK DISCUSSION
This talk is a follow-up to our book club meetup, where we'll be discussing Claus's new book, Fundamentals of Data Visualization. You can RSVP for that book discussion here: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-austin/events/260447257/. Note that the book is code/language agnostic and will make for a great intro to all of the plots and concepts that Claus will cover in his talk.

DESCRIPTION
The R package ggplot2 provides a powerful and flexible approach to data visualization, and it is suitable both for rapid exploration of different visualization approaches and for producing carefully crafted publication-quality figures. However, getting ggplot2 to make figures that look exactly the way you want them to can sometimes be challenging, and beginners and experts alike can get confused by themes, scales, coords, guides, or facets. We will discuss best practices for getting the most out of ggplot2, including how to choose and customize scales, how to theme plots, and when and how to use extension packages.

LOCATION
Dell Medical School
Health Learning Building
Main Auditorium Room 1.111
1501 Red River Street
Austin TX, 78712

PARKING
Parking in the closest parking lot 108 is restricted to those with UT Austin parking permits. Metered parking is available nearby on Red River Street and Trinity Street. Paid parking is also available in the Health Center Garage at the corner of 15th Street and Trinity.

SCHEDULE
6:30 - 7pm -- Food and networking
7 - 8:30pm -- Claus's talk
8:30 - 9pm -- Questions, wrap-up, and close

venues.name: Dell Medical School - Health Learning Building

title: Book Club: Fundamentals of Data Visualization by Claus Wilke
description:
We are excited to announce the next book in our R-Ladies Book Club will be Fundamentals of Data Visualization: A Primer on Making Informative and Compelling Figures by Claus Wilke!

We're also excited to announce that Claus will be doing a companion talk, "Practical ggplot2", as a follow-up in June! This talk will be focused on getting into the code and the "how" of building some of the figures in the book. RSVP here: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-austin/events/260426142/

Topics covered in this book are:
* Explore the basic concepts of color as a tool to highlight, distinguish, or represent a value
* Understand the importance of redundant coding to ensure you provide key information in multiple ways
* Use the book’s visualizations directory, a graphical guide to commonly used types of data visualizations
* Get extensive examples of good and bad figures
* Learn how to use figures in a document or report and how employ them effectively to tell a compelling story

Note that this book is not specific to any single language (and doesn't deep-dive the code used to generate the figures). If you're interested in learning more about how to create the figures using ggplot2 and R, please check out Claus's follow-up talk: https://www.meetup.com/rladies-austin/events/260426142/

Please join us for a discussion over a beer or coffee/tea!

FINDING THIS BOOK

This book is available free online at https://serialmentor.com/dataviz/.

A hard copy of this book will be released on April 15th -- here's a link to order the book on Amazon: https://www.amazon.com/Fundamentals-Data-Visualization-Informative-Compelling/dp/1492031089.

title: Lightning talks with Austin R User Group
description:
Hello R Ladies!

We are happy to announce this joint meetup with Austin R User Group. The meetup will focus on lightning talks, including potentially a few guest speakers from UT!

Here is how we see the evening going:
6-6:45pm: Light snacks, drinks, and mingling
6:45-8pm: Lightning talks
8-8:30pm: Wrap up and mingling with speakers

Confirmed speakers:
James Curley (UT Professor of Psychology)
"Using RCloud for Teaching Statistics"

Cory Zigler (UT Professor of Statistics)
"Data Science for Evaluating Air Pollution Policies"

Joy Wyckoff (UT Grad Student in Psychoogy)
"Using RShiny with Google Drive to Create Surveys and Automate Data Aggregation"

Corinne Leopold (Data Scientist at IBM)
"A home for your functions: Creating an R package"

Are you interested in presenting your work? Or perhaps sharing a cool package you discovered that others should know about? What about a neat project you want feedback on? Please email us and let us know! rladiesaustin@gmail.com

Hope to see you there!
Victoria + Caitlin

title: GitHub Patchwork Workshop
description:
Please RSVP to this event using this link: https://ti.to/github-events/Patchwork-Austin

A GitHub Patchwork is a 3 hour long hands-on, learn-by-doing event with the goal of getting people using GitHub. No coding experience is necessary to attend. These are very casual events that are designed to be gentle introductions to Git, GitHub, and the pursuit of open source.

Attendees need to bring a laptop that can connect to the internet. The event is hosted by GitHub Documentation team and they will have team members available to answer intermediate and advanced questions about Git and GitHub.

Where? Microsoft, Austin office at Quarry Oaks II. Microsoft is kindly letting us use one of their conference rooms for the workshop.

*Parking The patchwork will be at 10900-B Stonelake Blvd, Austin, TX 78759. Parking is free in the surface lot in front of the building.

Please join us!

title: rstudio::conf R-Ladies Meetup!
description:
The folks at RStudio are planning an R-Ladies event to directly follow the closing remarks at rstudio::conf. This event will be open to all R-Ladies (non-conference attendees are welcome!). This will be a great chance to meet and network with R-Ladies from across the country -- hope to see you there!

We'll kick off at 6pm on Friday, January 18th in room Park View A (7th Floor) at the Fairmont Hotel.

For those visiting from out of town, no need to RSVP here — we’ll see you at the happy hour!
